properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 1 at 12:49PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
For those venturing out on Monday morning, expect continued light
snowfall through your commute with the possibility of slippery
conditions and low visibilities. Snow will being falling again
this evening. Several inches are expected to accumulate in locations
from the Matanuska Valley down through the Anchorage Bowl. In
general, about 3 to 5 inches are expected, with locally higher
amounts at higher elevations. This snow will once again be dry
and fluffy, so it could easily drift around from vehicle traffic.
The snow event will slowly come to an end around midday Monday.

For the latest on road conditions, please call 5 1 1 or visit
511.alaska.gov. Please allow extra time and space when traveling.
